# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for the required function:

```julia
function wrap_string(input::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input, " ")
    output_lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(output_lines, current_line * "\n") # Add newline and start new line 
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= "$word "
    end

    push!(output_lines, current_line) # Add the last line without a trailing newline
    
    return join(output_lines, "") # Combine lines into single string
end
```
You can test this function with following example:

```julia
str = "This is a sample sentence. It wraps the words when they are too long."
println(wrap_string(str))
```
